hello thank you for the breakdown: question how did you arrive 2z+2=4y+4: 16y/4 for y = 4? am lost?  : (
​ @reubenarceo3832  Since,  2z + 2 = 4y + 4   we know the value of 2z (i.e 18)  18 + 2= 20 20=4y+4 Y=16/4 Y= 4

​ @phoneixforce9680  hello! I am very sorry where did the 2z+2 come from? is it like a formula?🥲  I saw another comment who landed with the same answer but, they got the 20 from 4y+4=20 by doubling the 10 in z+1/9+1=10

​​ @rihyanny     think of it like this,  for 18 it will be 2z because   Let (imagine for now) 18 be 2x then on the z place it will be x (half of the original value) i.e  18=2x Z=x   just like shown in the video. 18 will be equal to 2x ( as "x" is half of "18" for it to be equal we write "2x" equal to 18 and also to find the value of x )  Now back to the question again,  Therefore z=18/2                     z=9  Just like that  z +1 is half of 4y + 4  So we do 2( z+1)= 2z + 2 2z+2=4y+4 Put in z value  2×9+2=4y+4 20=4y+4 Y=16/4 Y=4   Now x=3y-5 ( here the whole bottom side of the triangle is not completely 3y-5 only half and x is already half of the original value so we can directly write x is equal to 3y-5) Insert the values   x=3y-5 x=3×4-5 x=7
@phoneixforce9680  Thank you so much!!
